message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.GR, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the visualization of co-phylogenetic trees, which involves the representation of mappings among the nodes of two trees. This problem can be seen as a graph drawing problem, which falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG) and graph theory (cs.DS). The paper also addresses the problem of minimizing the number of crossings in the representation, which is a common problem in graph drawing and falls under the category of graph algorithms (cs.DS) and graph theory (cs.GR). The paper proposes heuristics for computing representations with few crossings, which involves optimization techniques and falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper deals with the co-evolution of hosts and parasites in biology, which falls under the category of bioinformatics (cs.BIO) and social and information networks (cs.SI).
